content.description:
Highball crack climb above a bad landing. Scout out the topout before you climb it, as it gets dirty. 

 Stack a pad on top of the sharp boulder below and fill the gap between the boulder and the wall to save your ankles. Sit start from here.
content.protection: pads, preferably two to protect the crappy boulder underneath the problem.
content.location: Left most route on the left wall of the creek gap, upstream side.

content.description:
Just downstream from the Plan B Boulder, Eagle Creek splits two large granite faces. This wall consists of generally poor granite, and the climbs are taller (20 to 40 feet) with less than optimal landings (in the creek). Several options exist here and apart from traverse options, almost all are highball problems. On very dry years you might be able to pad up the landings, but on taller problems, this wouldn't do much.

 Please DO NOT BOLT any of these faces (including TR anchors) until the appropriate access can be established with the City of Alto/ Village of Ruidoso. Until such time, highball/solo at your own risk.
